name: Woo Shop Slider Lite
author: Shindiri Studio

sections.description:
Create amazing content with one of our 8 totally different WooCommerce slider styles. You can easily place featured products in a cool responsive slider and let your visitors fully experience what you have to offer.

Sliders generate a shortcode which means that they can be placed anywhere on your website and they will fit right into the content. We have also created a Visual Composer shortcode, so if you have both Visual Composer and WooShop Slider you can easily add new sliders to your content.

Upgrade to the Pro Version Now » | Live demo | Documentation

Features

  • WooCommerce slider
  • Visual Composer friendly
  • Lazy loading
  • Responsive design
  • Product quick view
  • Swipe
  • Less files included
  • Ajax add to cart
  • And much much more
sections.installation: There are 3 simple steps that you need to follow in order to properly install and use Woo Shop Slider. First you need to install the plugin, then you need to select the version of the slider that you like most and you need to select your categories or products and you are good to go.
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

There are 3 simple steps that you need to follow in order to properly install and use Woo Shop Slider. First you need to install the plugin, then you need to select the version of the slider that you like most and you need to select your categories or products and you are good to go.

Would maintenance mode make the plugin not work?

When in maintenance mode your site is not visible to the world, but the content is guaranteed to be there when the maintenance mode is switched off.

Is this plugin fully responsive and working well with responisve sites?

Yes, plugin is responsive and compatible with responsive sites.

What sliders are included in the free version?

The free version have only “Straight” slider version.

How can I add a slider to a Widget?

You can add shortcode in text widget and place it in any sidebar area.

To enable shortcodes in text widget add this to your theme functions.php file:
// Enable shortcodes in text widgets
add_filter( ‘widget_text’, ‘do_shortcode’ );

UPDATE August 14th, 2018 – Version 1.2.3

  • Fix: Error – Catchable fatal error: Object of class WP_Error could not be converted to string
  • Updated: Translation files update

UPDATE July 31th, 2018 – Version 1.2.2

  • Fixed: Cannot use string offset as an array for PHP >= 7.1

UPDATE May 24th, 2017 – Version 1.2.1

  • Update: readme.txt update

UPDATE May 24th, 2017 – Version 1.2.0

  • Fixed: Small plugin admin and frontend css fixes
  • Fixed: Avada quick view quantity buttons conflict
  • Updated: Compatible with WooCommerce 3.0.0 and versions below
  • Updated: Translation files update
  • Added: Random products sorting
  • Tested: Compatibility with Visual Composer 5.1.1.
  • Tested: Compatibility with WordPress 4.7.5
  • Tested: Compatibility with WooCommerce 3.0.7

UPDATE December 07th, 2016 – Version 1.0.6

  • Update: Readme file update

UPDATE December 07th, 2016 – Version 1.0.5

  • update: Tested up to in plugin main file
  • Update: Version 1.0.5

UPDATE December 07th, 2016 – Version 1.0.4

  • fixed: Small plugin admin css fix
  • tested: Compatible with WordPress 4.7

UPDATE November 08th, 2016 – Version 1.0.3

  • fixed: Changed textdomain to comply with WordPress.org requirements

UPDATE November 01st, 2016 – Version 1.0.2

  • update: Readme file update

UPDATE October 26th, 2016 – Version 1.0.1

  • bugfix: Quick look product sale ribbon displayed on all products instead only on those on sale. Now fixed
  • bugfix: Multisite failed to activate Quick look component
  • Bugfix: Left arrow centered for Straight slider
  • Changed: External/Affiliate product now show price with discount instead of only discount price
  • Fixed: Quick view “view cart” button custom background color. View cart that appear after product is added to cart in quick view modal window
  • Fixed: Rare case fatal error if lite version and full version are activated simultaneously
